channel.title: The Euros 2020 by CSR
channel.description: Recent content on The Euros 2020 by CSR

item.title: Day 27
item.description: Italy v Spain Penalty shootout Locatelli (0-0) Olmo (0-0) Belotti (1-0) Moreno (1-1) Bonucci (2-1) Thiago (2-2) Bernardeschi (3-2) Morata (3-2) Jorginho (4-2) In a repeat of the Euro 2012 final, Italy and Spain faced off. Spain were the ones who started off strong but the lack of a finisher was missing as the stand in Oyarzabal among others missed some great chances to score(Something Italy need to work on for the final).

item.title: Day 23
item.description: Czech Republic v Denmark Valiant effort from the Czechs but it was not enough. Denmark dominated the game from the start and took the lead after just 5 minutes from a corner from Delaney. After a round of chances Dolberg finally made it 2 after a peach of a cross from Maehle who used the outside of his boot. In the second half however Czech Republic were getting back in it due to a change in tactics and managed to pull one back via Schick with a great cross.

item.title: Day 22
item.description: Switzerland v Spain Penalty shootout Busquets (0-0) Gavranovic (1-0) Olmo (1-1) Schar (1-1) Rodri (1-1) Akanji (1-1) Moreno (1-2) Vargas (1-2) Oyarzabal (1-3) A great performance from the Swiss but not enough in the end as they lost in their second penalty shootout after their Round of 16 clash against France. Spain took the lead when a corner was met by Jordi Alba and his shot took a huge deflection from Zakaria(coming in for Xhaka), wrong footing Sommer to score.

item.title: Day 19
item.description: England v Germany The first half was completely dead from both sides not wanting to give the other space to attack. The main chance in the first half came from Harry Kane latching onto a loose ball but took a heavy touch and Hummels cleared it. The introduction of Grealish however changed the game. Shaw was even more threatening along with him and Grealish set it up for Shaw whose low cross was met by Sterling.

item.title: Day 18
item.description: Croatia v Spain A brilliant game which started off on a comical note. Spain were very threatening in the first few minutes. However a back pass from Pedri was controlled badly by Unai Simon leading to an own goal, the 9th of the tournament. To put this into perspective, 18 have been scored in the entire history of the Euros and 9 have come from this very tournament. Crazy. It was first credited as an Unai Simon own goal before being changed to a Pedri own goal.

item.title: Day 17
item.description: Netherlands v Czech Republic What a game!! I never saw this coming. Looking at the way the first half panned out, I still thought the Dutch will go through. The second half was where things changed. De Ligt did a handball which was first penalised with a yellow since it was outside the box but it was later converted to a red by VAR since it was intentional. Netherlands had a great chance at the end of the first half when Van Aanholt hit wide when he had a lot of time.

item.title: Day 16
item.description: Wales v Denmark Denmark were absolutely brilliant in this game. They will now be facing either Netherlands or Czech Republic. Kasper Dolberg was amazing in the absence of Poulsen and scored a great brace in what is his stadium when playing for Ajax. Wales did look threatening in a the first 10-12 minutes but could not finish their chances. Dolberg first scored with a great curler from outside the box. Later he scored again after a shambolic clearance from the substitute Willams who came on after Roberts pulled his groin.

item.title: Day 13
item.description: Sweden v Poland A brilliant thriller from Poland on their last match. Sweden played well and their position in the group has given them a favourable match in the Round of 16 but it may be challenging for them. An early goal from Forsberg gave them the lead with a great finish on his left. Lewa had a chance in the first chance to get back in it when his first header hit the post and he hit the post again on the rebound.

item.title: Day 12
item.description: Czech Republic v England England top the group after this win. They were pretty threatening from the get go from Grealish and Saka and Sterling scored with a header after a brilliant ball in by Grealish. After that chances came to the Czechs as well. Pickford made a brilliant save from long range. England did have a few more chances and Henderson actually scored but the touch from Bellingham meant he was offside so it was disallowed.

item.title: Day 11
item.description: Finland v Belgium Going into this match day, Finland still had a chance for being 2nd in the group. That chance is mostly gone if the other match does not go their way. Belgium were absolutely brilliant off the blocks but were denied for a while by the brilliant Hradecky. But unfortunately, the last(or second last) contribution he did was score an own goal. The corner came in from Belgium, Vermaelen’s header came off the bar and hit Hradecky on the way in.

item.title: Day 10
item.description: Ukraine v Austria Austria were wasteful in chances, Ukraine were wasteful in possession. Nevertheless, this means that Austria go through as Team no 2 from Group C. This means they’ll be facing Italy in the Round of 16. Austria were looking dangerous from corners and one in particular from Alaba was put in by Baumgartner who is now the youngest scorer in this tournament now. Ukraine wasted a couple good chances but overall they were poor.

item.title: Day 9
item.description: Spain v Poland Morata and Moreno made Szczesny look good along with his amazing saves too. Morata missed a few chances before he did score which was given a scare when it was ruled out for offside but was overturned by VAR. Spain were then wasteful. This turned up the pressure and Poland equalised in the second half from none other than Lewandowski. Laporte with a school boy error who got easily pushed by Lewa before heading it in.

item.title: Day 8
item.description: England v Scotland I guess you could say this was a moral victory for Scotland given their history. They frustrated England well along with England themselves being wasteful in the rainy pitch. The fans booing didn’t help(At least there was no reason to play the song now heh. For reference: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RJqimlFcJsM). Scotland had a few decent chances from Che Adams but that was it. Foden missed again, Kane missed, Stones hit the post, Everything went wrong for them in this derby.

item.title: Day 7
item.description: Netherlands v Austria The Dutch are through. This could have been more convincing with maybe 3 or 4 but it does the job. A penalty from Depay gave the lead and he should’ve made it 2 with an easy chance given to him. At the end, another goal from Dumfries gave them the confirmation. Austria never really had all too many chances to talk about. Sweden v Slovakia This was a fairly even game with chances on both sides but the keepers did well until Dubravka conceded the penalty that gave the Swedes the lead.

item.title: Day 6
item.description: Italy v Switzerland Italy are through with yet another 3-0 win in a dominant showing. Locatelli becoming the first Italian since Balotelli to score a brace in the Euros which capped off a great performance from the youngster. Immobile capped it off with a brilliant goal as well Ukraine v North Macedonia Ukraine did well in this game dominating and scoring 2 great goals. Second half was fairly even with both sides getting chances but denied by their respective keepers.

item.title: Day 4
item.description: Hungary v Portugal I HAVE NO PITY TOWARDS HUNGARY. God, this game was hard to watch. Portugal were frustrated heavily by Hungary who were ultra defensive(Can give Jose a run for his money) and Jota can’t even play properly as he missed a golden chance to give the ball to CR7 and took on the shot himself. I swear the game was better when Andre Silva came on. Renato Sanches as well was a star turn as they were a breath of fresh air and capitalised on a tiring Hungary.

item.title: Day 5
item.description: Finland v Russia Russia Domination overall. Finland did get an early chance with Pohjanpalo scoring but it was ruled out due to offside. Finally before halftime, Miranchuk scored a brilliant goal past Hradecky to get the winner. After that, a brilliant performance from Hradecky kept the score at 1-0. Turkey v Wales Turkey were incredibly wasteful. Ramsey put Wales in front before half time. Turkey had a few good chances but the best one was put over by Yilmaz when he was right before the goal.

item.title: Day 3
item.description: Netherlands v Ukraine What a thriller for the Dutch on their return to a major tounrament. First Half was all square. The second half saw a few openings and Wijnaldum scored first capitalising on the rebound from the initial save. Then, Weghorst scored although may be a foul but it was given anyway. Then the comeback happened first via a SCREAMER from Yarmolenko in the top bin and then with a header from a set piece(Maybe could be the Dutch’s undoing in this tourney).

item.title: Day 2
item.description: Belgium v Russia This was another easy match I feel. Belgium did amazing. Lukaku strong contender for the Golden Boot. First goal was unlucky since the defender’s touch nullified the offside against Lukaku. Second one was a rebound and a good goal from Meunier. The last goal was a mere formality from Lukaku. Belgium Looking Strong. England v Croatia An utter BOREFEST. I get that you need to defend the lead but COME ON.

item.title: Day 1
item.description: Italy v Turkey This was inevitable. Italy just dominated. Unfortunate that the first goal was an own goal(2018 vibes anyone?). Italy could’ve had around 4 or maybe 5. The remaining 2 were easy. Immobile scoring in the rebound and Insigne curling an absolute beauty. Wales v Switzerland Pretty good watch actually. The Welsh striker was alone mostly since Switzerland were dominating in attack. The first goal was deserved but they could’ve perhaps scored a few other chances.
